name: Windows Live Messenger Emoticon File
summary: Learn about .ID2 files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: ID2 files are encrypted and decrypted using a WLM user's Passport User ID (PUID). In Windows XP, ID2 files typically are stored in the following user subdirectory: "\Application Data\Microsoft\Messenger\[LiveID]\ObjectStore\CustomEmoticons".
In Windows Vista, they typically are stored in the following user subdirectory: "\AppData\Microsoft\Messenger\[LiveID]\ ObjectStore\CustomEmoticons".
ID2 files often have cryptic names because they are automatically named using a hash of the .DT2 file.
NOTE: Windows Live Messenger was discontinued in 2013 and has moved to Skype.
